entry.et: Middle English ernest, from Old English eornost; akin to Old High German ernust earnest

def.dt: :a serious and intent mental state a proposal made in earnest
:a considerable or impressive degree or amount the sap started running in earnest
:characterized by or proceeding from an intense and serious state of mind

entry.et: Middle English ernes, ernest, from Anglo-French arres, erres, plural of erre earnest, from Latin arra, short for arrabo, from Greek arrhabōn, of Semitic origin; akin to Hebrew ʽērābhōn pledge

def.dt: :something of value given by a buyer to a seller to bind a bargain
:a token of what is to come :pledge
